intro: Senecio frigidus, commonly known as the alpine groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Senecio frigidus is often found in high-altitude areas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
